cab.content: 0:8163 jcol His Br;-,.: , . 7"*:----- TELEGRAM. Tho Governor Gonoral of Canada to the Secretary ofState for tiie Colonies. (Received Colonial Office 6ou p.in. loth September 1919)Most urgent September 13th. Following Order in Council was approved this day begins at Government House Ottawa Saturday 13th September 1919 present deputy Governor General in Council V\/here?s at Versailles on 2bth June 1919 Agreement between^United States of America Belgium British Empire and France and Germany with regard to Military occupation of territories of Rhine was concluded ."nd signed on behalf of His Majesty for and in respect of Dominion of Canada by plenipotentiaries duly authorised for that purpose by His Majesty on advice and recommendation of Government of Dominion of Canada.And whereas Senate and house of Commons of Dominion of Canada have by resolution approved of snid agreement.And whereas it is expedient that said agreement be ratified by His large sty for and in respect of Dominion of Canada,Uo\7 therefore deputy Governor General in-Council on recommendation of Secretary of State External Affairs is pleased to order and dotn hereby order that His Majesty the rang be humbly moved to approve accept confirm and ratify said treaty for i^nd in respect of Dominion of Canada. Ends., . . . .....DEVONSHIRE.
